metadata.Title: CVE-2009-1182 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the JBIG2 MMR decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, Poppler before 0.10.6, and other products allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-1182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler58 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> CUPS on Ubuntu uses system pdftops (compiled with --disable-pdftops)

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
